alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 27 at 2:36AM CST until December 27 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Carlton and South St. Louis County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Fond du Lac Band. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 AM this morning to 6 PM CST this evening. For the Blizzard Warning, until 10 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing and falling snow could significantly reduce visibility and create white-out conditions at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
